alert.note: Alert for Adams (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 5:27PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Adams and Morgan. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 527 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Antelope Creek, Rock Creek, East Fork Little Muddy Creek, Bijou Creek, West Bijou Creek, East Bijou Creek, Muddy Creek, West Fork San Arroyo Creek, Little Antelope Creek, and Badger Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Morgan, Log Lane Village, Adena, Hoyt, Twelve-Mile Corner, Shamrock, Leader, Adena School and Hoyt Beet Dump.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
